title: Boston National Historical Park: Collections
body: Explore This Park    Learn About the Park     History & Culture     Collections              Collections      Collections:  Shipyard records and material from the Navy's time in Charlestown  70,000 photographs and negatives of the Boston Naval Shipyard and surrounding establishments  13,000 architectural drawings Records from the First Naval District Ship history files of ships that were built, launched, repaired, or commissioned at Boston Naval Shipyard  The Boston Naval Shipyard News (the newspaper of the yard) USS Cassin Young photographs, blueprints, manuals, and ship records Visitor registers for Bunker Hill Monument, as well as documents relating to the monument's history Documents relating to Faneuil Hall, Dorchester Heights, Old North Church, Old State House, and Old South Meeting House  For more information on Boston National Historical Park's collections, please contact David Vecchioli, Museum Curator, at 617-242-5603.  On Line Resources   Below you will find links to some of our on line resources   New Hampshire Participants in the Battle of Bunker Hill (pdf file--322K) Ships built in the Charlestown Navy Yard (pdf file--461K) Development of Shipbuilding at the Charlestown Navy Yard
